author: Richard Easterling
title: Cardano Wallet Flutter SDK
description: Flutter is the fastest growing mobile app developer community but currently there's no Flutter library support in the Cardano ecosystem.

assessments.note:
Flutter is a great development environment. As far as I know, there is currently no library to access Cardano chain, unlike web3dart for "web3 Ethereum".

Sharing a library would indeed ease the integration of Cardano in flutter apps.
Having another SDK für Cardano is a very good fit for the challenge. Flutter/Dart is a rising start and a good addition to the already existing/planned solutions.
Widening the developer toolkit to include Flutter seems like a good idea.
I think it is good idea to built a library for flutter. To grow the cardano ecosystem you need tools to make things easier.
Targeting integrating into a popular web app/mobile app SDK, most definitely addresses the developer challenge.

Fluter is a google promoted next-generation framework for the cross-platform app generation. Availability of any form of API interface with Cardano in Dart will enhance app development in Cardano to a great extent.

Software Development kits (SDKs) constitute the corner stone of any dev ecosystem. This proposal aims to provide a Flutter SDK specifically for wallet operations.
Flutter is a new platform allowing developers to maintain only one code base for iOS and Android mobile devices, it also supports web and desktop deployment of the same base code... Flutter is still young (just a few years) as a platform but is backed by Google.
Making a Flutter SDK is very important as it will make Cardano an option for literally tens of thousands of developers on just all the existing consumer platforms.
Flutters will streamline mobile development for every mobile devices on the planet lowering the maintenance cost. Although the proposal depicted is a long term project and only sets the bases it is a very important one.

Without SDK, each developer needs to reinvent the wheel in order to solve common problems instead of focusing on their real project.

A quality SDK ensures reliability for all the application depending on it and rapid development. The availability of an SDK is many times what will make the difference when choosing a platform to develop on. Since there are many other blockchain projects competing with Cardano, the more SDKs there are the better.

The stated experience is very convincing and I am very happy that Blockfrost is mentioned in the proposal. If an api-gateway is used, the proposer can fully concentrate on the development of the flutter/dart components.

It looks like Richard has enough experience to realize the project. 100 paid hours should also give him some buffer to finish the project. An open point is how this library will be updated. This a key for future usage.
Detailed enough plan, and relevant experience presented. The technical details are well explained and consistent.
The proposer has claimed substantial experience in a large number of software technologies. His Github page has code from 2014 and has around 13 repositories.

The proposer's experience is important and totally fits the scope of his project. We just regret the lack of a direct link to his LinkedIn profile but it can be found easily: www.linkedin.com/in/richardeasterling/ . There are also links to his GitHub profile where we can see that he does have experience and has already started working on the project.
There is only one person behind this proposal but major part of the code will be open source and given the low budget there is not much risk and the benefit will be huge if the proposal is successful.
Work has already been started and a demo app is already available. So it's clear that the proposer is committed to this project.
Moreover the detailed plan shows that challenges and risks have been considered and that the project is well under way even before funding (some of the comments also confirm this).

The proposal of making a library & a demo wallet totally makes sense to me.

I think making sure the app also works on Android and iOS would better answer the overall challenge.
Possible KPIs were mentioned but sometimes no concrete figures were provided. The finalization after 2 months is pretty good. Not much auditing will be needed.
Adding more app development options for the Cardano ecosystem meets this challenge and the proposal seems feasible.
I would break down the roadmap. In 2 months i am finished is not enough. Also it would help to define KPI goals e.g 1000 Downloads after 1 year.
The plan and break down of the technical challenges to be resolved are well explained and consistent.

The progress can be audited by monitoring Github for updates and achieving the features provided in the proposal. The steps and the features expected out of the API are covered clearly in the proposal.

The progress of this project will be visible both through the demo app (closed source) and the open source SDK (Apache 2.0 license) on GitHub. The closed source demo app development is not part of the budget, although we may regret this, it is not a problem because the best way to make sure an SDK is actually useful is to create it to support a real use case, the demo app will thus ensures that the SDK is focused on what is truly necessary and actually works in real usage conditions. So it seems that all the conditions are here for this proposal to go as planned.

solution: Publish an open-source Flutter library to encourage mobile app development in the Cardano ecosystem.
